duplicates.evidence: Both PRs address identical issue: 'allow $schema key in config'. PR #15004 created 2026-02-12T21:30:22Z by arosstale, PR #15009 created 2026-02-12T21:34:31Z by shtse8 (9-minute gap). Identical titles and intent (JSON Schema editor support / config root). Both XS size, both non-draft, missing same metadata. High temporal proximity (same day, minutes apart) and identical scope indicates supersession or duplicate submission. Confidence 0.92 due to identical fix target and near-simultaneous creation.

Both PRs address Slack file attachment handling. PR #4158 'support multiple file attachments' and PR #10685 'resolve all file attachments instead of only the first' appear to target the same underlying issue (handling multiple Slack file attachments). PR #10685 is from established author (20% merge rate, experienced-contributor label) vs first-time author of #4158. PR #10685 likely supersedes #4158 given author credibility and explicit label; #4158 may be closed in favor of #10685.

Both from cortexuvula targeting Android platform within same timeframe (2026-01-31). However, PRs target distinct subsystems (Ed25519 crypto vs. microphone permissions), suggesting separate bug fixes rather than duplicates. Same author + Android + same day raises minor coincidence flag but PR titles and scopes are unrelated. Low confidence reflects weak evidence.

Both address path resolution in gateway/Control UI context (CWD for Control UI vs. OPENCLAW_HOME for internal paths). However, different authors (battman21 vs. sebslight), different timelines (2026-02-04 vs. 2026-02-08), and different scope (gateway-specific vs. multi-category). Could represent separate phases of same refactoring, but insufficient evidence of direct supersession.

All six PRs authored by Ayush10 (same author). Identical label structure: all touch 15 channels (bluebubbles, discord, imessage, line, matrix, msteams, nostr, signal, slack, telegram, voice-call, whatsapp-web, zalo, zalouser) + 8 categories (docs, apps, gateway, extensions, cli, scripts, commands, docker, agents). Pattern suggests either: (1) batch submission of related fixes with shared labeling issue, (2) mislabeled PRs inheriting labels from a parent PR, or (3) systematic architectural misunderstanding by author. High likelihood these are related/superseded work or represent mislabeling of a single feature across multiple PRs. Recommend deduplication review—likely only one intended submission or systematic label inheritance from automation.
